report_title: Online Vitamin & Supplement Sales in the US
executive_summary: The COVID-19 pandemic transformed how consumers view vitamins and supplements and interact with e-commerce, leading online vitamin retailers to thrive in a post-pandemic environment. The surge in sales, coupled with a lasting shift in consumer behavior, showcases the growing importance of vitamins and supplements in supporting wellness. Social media has driven interest and sales, with influencers and content creators promoting these products to a broad audience. As the industry has evolved, brands and retailers have adapted, introducing innovative formulations and personalized options to meet changing demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Vitamin Retailers Thrive in a Postpandemic Environment
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consumers' heightened interest in vitamins and supplements isn't expected to subside moving forward but will stabilize as the industry moves away from the pandemic. Online retailers will be central to meeting demand, including established product lines and new innovative ones. Retailers will increasingly leverage technology to enhance supply chain management, optimize inventory and improve logistics, while advances in research and formulation will bring more specialized supplements to the market, sustaining demand.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Health and Wellness Trends Take Off on Social Media
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: A growing focus on health and wellness has created a ripe environment for online vitamin and supplement retailers to tap into. Social media has become a powerful tool in promoting healthy lifestyles, including vitamins and supplements, providing a unique opportunity for retailers to connect directly with consumers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Vitamin and Supplement Space Looks and Feels Completely New
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The vitamin and supplement space has significantly transformed, creating a new look and feel. Both brands and retailers within this industry have recognized the evolving consumer demands and shifting market dynamics, leading to notable changes in their strategies and approaches.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Personalized Treatments Will Grow in Popularity
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The popularity of personalized vitamins and supplements will continue to expand as more people seek tailored health solutions to fit their individual needs and lifestyles moving forward.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Personalized Vitamin and Supplement Plans Will Appeal to Consumers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As consumers become more proactive in managing their health and well-being, they seek customized solutions that address their needs. Personalized vitamin and supplement plans cater to this desire for targeted interventions, allowing individuals to optimize their health and achieve their wellness goals.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Virtual Consulting Services Will Appeal to Consumers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As telehealth becomes more accepted by consumers, the demand for online vitamins and supplements will increase.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Influencer Marketing Will Be a Key Driver for Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Social media has been an increasingly popular way for retailers, especially online retailers, to advertise their business. Additionally, brands will partner with influencers to further promote their products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: New Regulations Could Pose a Threat to Sellers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Regulations for vitamin and supplement manufacturers are always rising, which in turn affect sellers. Herbal supplements, in particular, are at risk of being discontinued or significantly altered due to regulatory changes, as many are little known but boast various benefits.

industry_definition: Online vitamin sale retailers are e-commerce businesses or platforms specializing in selling vitamins and dietary supplements online. Customers can browse product selections, compare prices, read reviews and make purchases through their websites or mobile apps. These retailers often offer various shipping options and may provide additional services such as subscription plans, auto-delivery, personalized recommendations or customer support for health and nutrition inquiries.

opportunities: Number of adults aged 50 and older
threats: Regulation for the Vitamin & Supplement Manufacturing industry

key_trends: New online vitamin and supplement shops open regularly, increasing already high competition.
Amazon captures a large portion of revenue due to its ability to sell a large variety of products.
The coronavirus boosted sales of immune system supplements as consumers became increasingly concerned about contracting coronavirus, resulting in unprecedented revenue growth.
Becoming an online seller of vitamins and supplements requires relatively low capital investment, attracting many new businesses.

GNC Holdings Inc. (GNC) is the largest brick-and-mortar retailer of vitamins and supplements. However, due to the fractured nature of the e-commerce space, GNC accounts for a relatively small share of revenue.
In 2022, Amazon acquired One Medical, a subscription-based healthcare provider, furthering its place in the healthcare spectrum.
Few public forms of assistance exist for online vitamin and supplement shops. Such businesses are supported by a slew of industry and industry-adjacent associations.
Revenue volatility is higher than usual, largely because of the coronavirus and its impact on the economy. Revenue spiked amid the pandemic as consumers stocked up on health products.
Profit is higher than brick-and-mortar competitors. Profit increased over the past five years due to rising spending on health products and declining operational costs.
Wages account for a small share of revenue. Most shops are small and employ few workers, relying more on automated technologies for inventory and sales management.

California is home to the most online vitamin and supplement sellers. The state's mix of densely populated metropolitan areas and more rural space is ideal for sellers who want to be close to their customers. Sellers benefit from being close to international trade ports.
Purchases represent the greatest operational cost for sellers. Any way to reduce purchase costs will help.

Vitamins and minerals remain the largest product segment. There are many types of vitamins and minerals, and the products have been around long enough that many consumers have accepted them and use them daily.
Sport nutrition products will continue growing in popularity. Rising health consciousness means more consumers will turn to sport nutrition products.
Niche products like nootropics represent a possible market for new sellers. Some sellers specialize in one or two product types, attracting a small but loyal following.

market_segmentation.segment: Older Adults Value the Benefits of Vitamins and Supplements
market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes consumers aged 55 and older. Consumers aged 55 and older are the largest market. Consumers in this age demographic generally have more health issues, resulting in greater purchases of vitamins and supplements.

market_segmentation.segment: Adults Represent a Growing Market for Sellers
market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes consumers aged between 35 and 54 years old. Many elderly consumers began taking certain vitamins and supplements at a younger age, making them a reliable and long-lasting market. Consumers aged 35 to 54 represent a growing market for online vitamin and supplement sales. Adults generally have more consistent disposable income than their younger and older counterparts and are usually more health-conscious than younger consumers. Many adults grew up taking vitamins or sports supplements, like protein shakes, and are a reliable base. As adults age and develop more health problems and concerns, they generally increase purchases of vitamins and supplements.

market_segmentation.segment: Young Adults are Difficult to Predict
market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes consumers aged between 25 and 34 years old. Young adults represent one of the smaller market segments. Young adults generally have less disposable income than older consumers and spend less on preventative healthcare items, like vitamins and supplements. Sports supplements, especially pre- and post-workout supplements, are especially popular with young adults. This market is quick to reduce spending when money is tight and is less likely to have developed brand loyalty.

market_segmentation.segment: Consumers Aged 24 and Younger Remain a Small Segment
market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment includes consumers under the age of 24. The youngest group of consumers represents the smallest market for sellers. Consumers aged 24 and younger have much less disposable income than older individuals, as many in the demographic have yet to enter the workforce. Younger individuals have fewer health concerns than older individuals, so they are less likely to spend limited funds on vitamins and supplements.

products_and_services.product_description: Vitamins and minerals include individual vitamins, like vitamin A or vitamin C, along with multivitamins and individual minerals, like zinc and potassium. Products may come in a variety of forms, including tablets, powders or liquids, among others.
Herbal supplements are varied but include items like ginkgo leaf extract, wheat and barley grass extracts, and turmeric, cranberry and aloe.
This product segment includes sport nutrition products. Sports nutrition products largely consist of protein powders, meal replacements and weight-loss products, among many others.

Dietary and other supplements include products like fish and flaxseed oil, antioxidants, sleep-promoting supplements and glucosamine. Certain niche products in these segments are rising in popularity, such as nootropics, which boast claims of improving various aspects of mental and physical well-being.

Generic Pharmaceutical Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: Brand Name Pharmaceutical Manufacturing in the US
Sanitary Paper Product Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The Healthy Eating Index (HEI) evaluates the quality of an individual's diet, with a higher score indicating healthier eating patterns. While an increasing HEI signifies consumers are incorporating more nutrient-dense foods into their diets, which can potentially reduce the reliance on vitamins and supplements, it still presents opportunities. A higher HEI signifies a growing interest among consumers in pursuing a healthy lifestyle, supporting demand for vitamins and supplements that complement nutritional, fitness or wellness goals.

business_locations.location_description: The West contains the highest share of online vitamin and supplement shops with the Southwest close behind. These regions are densely populated and are close to major trade ports, making acquiring certain products less expensive.
As new sellers enter the industry, many are seeking ways to decrease costs, resulting in the Great Lakes and Southeast regions becoming more attractive.

The Mid-Atlantic region has the third-highest number of online vitamin and supplement sellers. New York and New Jersey are the most popular states in the region for sellers given the high population in each state and its proximity to suppliers and downstream channels.
As new sellers enter the industry, many are seeking ways to decrease costs, resulting in the Great Lakes and Southeast regions becoming more attractive.

The West contains the highest share of online vitamin and supplement shops with the Southwest close behind. These regions are densely populated and are close to major trade ports, making acquiring certain products less expensive.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE FEDERAL FOOD, DRUG AND COSMETIC ACT
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) oversees the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act (FDCA). Through the FDCA, the FDA oversees the formulation, manufacturing, packaging, labeling, marketing, distribution and sale of dietary supplements, which include vitamins, minerals and herbs. Retailers specializing in online vitamin and supplement sales must adhere to these guidelines when they purchase inventory and sell to the final consumer.

The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) oversees the advertising and marketing of vitamins and supplements to protect consumers from misleading claims. Retailers must ensure that all health claims are truthful, not misleading and supported by scientific evidence.

Online vitamin and supplement retailers must adhere to data privacy and security regulations to protect consumer information. With the increasing reliance on e-commerce platforms, these regulations are essential.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Online vitamin and supplement retailers must navigate complex regulations, including FDA guidelines, labeling requirements and advertising restrictions, which can lead to compliance costs and legal liabilities.
Entering the online vitamin market requires substantial investment in inventory, e-commerce platforms, packaging and marketing, which can create high initial costs prohibitively for new retailers.
With the market approaching saturation, new retailers must offer unique product formulations, superior customer service or innovative branding to distinguish themselves.

basis_points.basis_title: New online vitamin and supplement shops open regularly
basis_points.basis_description: New online vitamin and supplement shops open regularly, increasing already high competition.

basis_points.basis_title: Amazon captures large portion of revenue
basis_points.basis_description: Amazon captures a large portion of revenue due to its ability to sell a large variety of products.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Amazon is synonymous with online retail
concentration_points.concentration_description: Amazon's vast and well-established e-commerce platform offers unparalleled reach and convenience. Its extensive product catalog, user-friendly interface and efficient logistics network allow it to quickly serve a broad customer base.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Procuring Inventory is the Single-Largest Cost
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The primary expense for any retailer is acquiring the products they sell.
Managing inventory levels, ensuring product freshness and aligning supply with fluctuating customer demand can be challenging.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Initial investments in an e-commerce infrastructure and inventory, along with ongoing costs for system upgrades and maintenance, can strain resources.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Navigating an evolving regulatory environment creates challenges
volatility_points.volatility_description: Regulatory changes can require significant shifts in product formulations, labeling requirements and ingredient approvals.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Consumer Trends Cause Sales to Ebb and Flow
volatility_points.volatility_description: Vitamin and supplement sales are sensitive to changes in consumer preferences.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: ONLINE RETAILERS INVEST IN ENGAGING E-COMMERCE PLATFORMS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online vitamin and supplement retailers are integrating data analytics to offer personalized product recommendations.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: HEALTH TRENDS SPUR NEW PRODUCT LAUNCHES
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Manufacturers consistently develop new formulations and ingredients in response to emerging health trends.

FAQs.question: How has your business adapted and taken advantage of the growth of online sales?
FAQs.answer: Brick-and-mortar retailers must appreciate the threat of the emergence of e-commerce.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Due to the immense shift to online retail which contributes to such tremendous growth, adverse economic conditions may depress industry revenue but should not reverse the industry's course.

FAQs.question: Does your company look to lease equipment in order to reduce overhead costs?
FAQs.answer: Companies should look to make investment in warehouse equipment and technology to increase operational productivity and efficiency.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand its reach and reduce its overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Traditionally brick-and-mortar stores are looking for e-commerce and technology startups to help them grow their online platform.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations?
FAQs.answer: Automation is hugely important in e-commerce; using robotic technology can streamline order fulfillment.

FAQs.question: Does your company use Point-of-sale (POS) systems to track inventory?
FAQs.answer: Operators should be aware of new POS technologies, including blockchain technology, that can improve inventory.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability?
FAQs.answer: Many states have enacted e-commerce tax laws, putting these retailers on a more level playing field with bricks-and-mortar stores.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Companies generally do not manufacture products, but must ensure that what is being sold is legal.
